image.altText: Nathaniel, Gareth and Stacey Train graphic black and white with aerial view of their property behind

props.synopsis: A Queensland coroner says the three extremists behind the Wieambilla attack, which claimed the lives of two young police officers and a neighbour, had a "shared delusional disorder" and were "intent" on killing.

title.children: Trio behind deadly police shooting had 'delusional disorder', coroner finds

image.altText: Share trader

props.synopsis: "Wild" Wall Street sell-off triggers a sea of red on ASX.

title.children: Sea of red for the ASX as DroneShield drops almost 12pc

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Japan's cabinet approves lavish $US135 billion stimulus as markets fret over fiscal policy

image.altText: An office worker talks on his phone as he looks the stock board at the Australian Securities Exchange

props.synopsis: Global markets are nervous after more than $3.1 trillion was wiped off Wall Street last night in a matter of hours, with Australia's ASX following suit today. So, what's behind the dip, and do analysts expect it to continue?

title.children: Millions of Australians' super on the line as market fears spread

image.altText: Joe Root looks back as he is caught out in a Test match.

props.synopsis: Mitchell Starc makes a typically hot start in the first Test against England as the Ashes kick off at Perth Stadium. Follow live.

title.children: Joe Root gone for a duck as Mitchell Starc lights up first day of Ashes

image.altText: A woman wearing a face mask, pink dress and white jacket

props.synopsis: A former Sydney teacher cannot be held financially liable for engaging in sexual activity with four male students in the 1970s, after a judge found she could not be expected to have known her conduct would cause harm.

title.children: Judge finds teacher couldn't have known abuse of boys would cause harm

image.altText: A sign that reads "The Star" below a star shape on the side of a high rise building.

props.synopsis: Under the deal, two US-based companies will own more than half of the embattled casino operator.

title.children: Regulators approve US-led $300m Star rescue deal

image.altText: Jim Jordan sits at a wooden desk in a leather chair in front of mustard-coloured curtains.

props.synopsis: The powerful chair of a United States congressional committee who called in the head of Australia's internet regulator to testify before US Congress says he does not think foreign governments should be telling America about its "First Amendment liberties".

title.children: Republican who called eSafety head a 'zealot' persists with call to testify

image.altText: Julie Inman Grant is Australia’s eSafety Commissioner stands in her officer in front of windows with her armed crossed

props.synopsis: Less than three weeks out from when the ban is due to come into force, the eSafety Commissioner revealed the platform would join the list of age-restricted social media sites.

title.children: Popular streaming site Twitch to be included in under 16s social media ban

image.altText: Track map 7.33am 21-11 jpg

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology has declared a cyclone warning for Darwin as Cyclone Fina intensifies while tracking towards the Northern Territory capital.

title.children: BOM declares cyclone warning for Darwin as Fina tracks south-west

image.altText: Closeup of two passenger plane tails parked at an airport, red 'Virgin' lettering on one, the other orange with 'JETstar'

props.synopsis: From December, major Australian flight carriers will prohibit passengers from using or charging power banks on planes, in a move endorsed by the aviation industry.

title.children: Travellers will no longer be able to use power banks on flights. Here's what to know

image.altText: A red sign that says "sale" in white writing is placed on a display rack of shoes

props.synopsis: When it comes to Black Friday sales, most shoppers expect to be accosted with aggressive marketing material. But the cumulative effects of these ads can be damaging.

title.children: What dodgy sales tactics to watch for this Black Friday

image.altText: neo-nazis rally outside nsw parliament

props.synopsis: While federal and state governments, police and national security agencies grapple with how to respond to the National Socialist Network, several financial institutions and service providers have acted independently to restrict the flow of funds to the white supremacy group.

title.children: The high price of hate: Neo-Nazi figure's funds frozen, fundraising blocked

image.altText: view from driving seat of car at night on orange lit road

props.synopsis: Driving instructors say they need national consistency on CCTV in their vehicles as transport ministers meet to discuss how to keep learner drivers safe from sexual harassment and assault.

title.children: Instructors seek certainty on CCTV as ministers meet on learner driver safety

image.altText: Ms Sloane in a blue blazer smiles as she talks into microphones at a media press conference with another woman behind her

props.synopsis: Former shadow health minister Ms Sloane was endorsed by Mr Speakman during a press conference announcing his resignation on Thursday afternoon and elected unopposed this morning.

title.children: New NSW opposition leader says 'we are ready for a fight'

image.altText: A composite of Xi Jinping and Sanae Takaichi

props.synopsis: China was already wary about Japan's new Prime Minister, Sanae Takaichi, a renowned Beijing hawk, before she weighed in on one of its most sensitive issues: Taiwan. Now it's unleashing economic pain.

title.children: Japan's PM said the quiet part out loud and unleashed Beijing's fury

image.altText: Malarndirri McCarthy looks at Scott Wilson. She is in focus.

props.synopsis: Malarndirri McCarthy says she understands states "will make their decisions in terms of elections" when it comes to rising incarceration rates, but that all leaders have a responsibility to examine to the "profound impacts" of policies.

title.children: Closing the Gap penalties still 'on the table', minister says

image.altText: Paul Kelly, wearing headphones, smiles and sings into a microphone in studio performance

props.synopsis: Nearly 20 years on from his debut on triple j's long-running covers segment, Paul Kelly and his trusty band take on Australia's queen of pop for their Like A Version comeback.

title.children: Paul Kelly does it again with Kylie Minogue cover for Like A Version

image.altText: A boab tree as dusk falls.

props.synopsis: A loud bang was heard in Kalgoorlie-Boulder on Thursday evening as a light quickly flashed across the sky.

title.children: 'Big bang' over Kalgoorlie believed to be a meteor

image.altText: Roma Wilson in front of her Thornton home, wearing flower blouse, holding walking stick, red tape and car destroyed

props.synopsis: A Hunter Valley teenager said he was just in the right place at the right time when he helped a 92-year-old woman to safety as her home was engulfed in flames.

title.children: School student helps 92yo escape home moments before 'massive explosion'

image.altText: A female student completes her exam using a laptop.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Assessment, Standards and Certification apologises to students after a fourth error in this year's Tasmanian Certificate of Education exams comes to light.

title.children: Regulator apologises as fourth error reported in Tasmanian exams

image.altText: People holding Australian flags outside Parliament House in Canberra.

props.synopsis: A growing number of sovereign citizens are clogging up Australian courts, after the global financial crisis and COVID-19 spurred a surge in the group's numbers in Australia.

title.children: A growing number of sovereign citizens are clogging up courts

image.altText: Gif showing illustration of a house with household items and a fighter jet flying above.

props.synopsis: Take a tour around the house and see how everyday life is powered by critical minerals and why we will keep hearing so much about them.

title.children: How critical minerals power our daily lives from the moment we wake up

image.altText: A space station in orbit over a cloudy day on Earth.

props.synopsis: Moss has the potential to provide food for astronauts of the future, according to a study that exposed one of Earth's oldest plants to the extremes of space travel.

title.children: Moss survived nine months in space outside the ISS before returning to Earth

image.altText: A police blockade in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: A bombmaker who created "homemade napalm" and whose arrest led to evacuations in Melbourne's CBD has been jailed for eight years.

title.children: Man boasted homemade bombs could 'legit bring down a whole apartment building'

image.altText: Green, pink, blue and multi-coloured sand products in transparent, white tubs on a white background.

props.synopsis: The online retail platform eBay Australia tells the ABC it uses artificial intelligence to stay informed of product recalls and to flag items that may be subject to a notice so they can be removed.

title.children: Coloured sand for sale on eBay removed days after asbestos recall

image.altText: Marm Fowler warming up for a Matildas match in 2025.

props.synopsis: Montpellier responds to racism allegations made by Matildas forward Mary Fowler, who says a teammate gave her bananas as a departing gift in 2022.

title.children: French football club denies Fowler's racism allegation

image.altText: A politician in a suit and tie, standing in front of a green sign with the Medicare logo.

props.synopsis: Medicare figures quietly published online show bulk-billing has not improved from a year ago, despite billions being tipped into the scheme. As out-of-pocket costs rise, GPs are delivering 10,000 fewer services every day compared to last year.

title.children: GP visits dropping by 10,000 a day, as cost pressures mount

image.altText: Two women hugging behind a bar.

props.synopsis: A pint-sized, pint-pouring granny becomes a social media star and the face of a country pub, as she adjusts from nursing to life behind the bar alongside her daughter.

title.children: Pint-sized granny publican becomes unlikely star of country pub

image.altText: A greater glider on a branch at nighttime

props.synopsis: New data points to the "systemic" under-reporting of greater glider dens within areas earmarked for logging in NSW, which scientists say could result in localised extinctions.

title.children: 'Absolute madness': Environment groups decry glider survey results

image.altText: An Australian LPGA golfer looks at the camera smiling, wearing green-tinted sunglasses and a white cap.

props.synopsis: Australians Minjee Lee, Grace Kim and Steph Kyriacou are all in the mix for a record $6.2 million pay day at women's golf's Tour Championship in Florida.

title.children: Minjee Lee leads Aussie push at rich Tour Championship

image.altText: A bed with a sleeping girl inside it, surrounded by clouds

props.synopsis: Mexican artist Frida Kahlo has become the most expensive female artist at auction, after her El sueno (la cama) painting sold for $US56 million.

title.children: Frida Kahlo painting sets new auction record for female artists

image.altText: A young black man in a black superhero bodysuit looks determinedly into the distance.

props.synopsis: Boseman, who played T'Challa in Marvel's Black Panther, died in 2020 at the age of 43 from colon cancer, which had been diagnosed previously.

title.children: Chadwick Boseman awarded posthumous star on Hollywood Walk of Fame

image.altText: F1 driver walking his his garage, wearing a coat and racing suit

props.synopsis: Formula 1 championship rivals Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris were off the pace during the first practice session in Las Vegas, as Ferrari's Charles Leclerc topped the time sheets.

title.children: McLaren duo off the pace as Leclerc fastest in first Las Vegas practice

image.altText: A mother giving her daughter pills out of a square bottle.

props.synopsis: As ADHD diagnoses rise, Australia's peak body for psychiatrists is calling for a national system to monitor and stop potential over-diagnosis of the condition.

title.children: Push for national approach to ADHD diagnoses as states forge different paths
